qas.question: What is the most common reason people seek out alternative medicine?

plausible_answers.text: concluded there is little difference in the effect of real, sham and no acupuncture

context: <a0_0>Pain<a0_0/> is the most common reason for people to use complementary and alternative medicine. An analysis of the 13 highest quality studies of pain treatment with <b6_0>acupuncture<b6_0/>, published in January 2009, <b5_0>concluded there is <a1_0>little difference in the effect<a1_0/> of real, sham and no acupuncture<b5_0/>. However other reviews have found <a2_0>benefit<a2_0/>. Additionally, there is tentative evidence for a few <a3_0>herbal<a3_0/> medicine. There is interest in the relationship between <a4_0>vitamin D<a4_0/> and <b7_0>pain<b7_0/>, but the evidence so far from controlled trials for such a relationship, other than in osteomalacia, is unconvincing.
